markdown:
#### ADVISORY:

Bank Transfer to Maya will be right back! Our partner is working to restore the service as soon as possible.

## Articles in this section

- [GCash Pro Platform Termination](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/45732029791513-GCash-Pro-Platform-Termination)
- [Advisory on Automated Fuel Dispenser (Self-Service Gas Pumps) Payments using GCash Cards](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/44449603684377-Advisory-on-Automated-Fuel-Dispenser-Self-Service-Gas-Pumps-Payments-using-GCash-Cards)

## Promoted articles

- [What are the steps to get a Fully Verified GCash account?](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/360017722393-What-are-the-steps-to-get-a-Fully-Verified-GCash-account)
- [Accepted IDs for GCash Verification](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/900000948786-Accepted-IDs-for-GCash-Verification)
- [How do I send money to another GCash account?](https://help.gcash.com/hc/en-us/articles/360017566614-How-do-I-send-money-to-another-GCash-account)

Starting **October 13, 2024**, GCash will be carrying out [Revenue Regulation (RR) No. 16-2023](https://bir-cdn.bir.gov.ph/BIR/pdf/RR%20No.%2016-2023%203.pdf), which states that **digital financial services providers such as GCash** must **withhold 1% tax on one-half of the total gross remittances** to sellers for goods or services sold by or paid to the Merchant through GCash.

### Who are affected?

**All merchants currently registered with GCash**, except those who will not derive or have not derived an annual cumulative gross remittance of PHP 500,000. A BIR-stamped Sworn Declaration is among the bases to determine whether the merchant meets said threshold and is subject to withholding.

**Customers will not be affected.**

### What to do next

To ensure swift compliance with the regulation, **all merchants must submit** the following:

1. BIR Certificate of Registration (BIR Form No. 2303 / COR)
2. Certificate of Tax Exemption or Proof of Lower Income Tax, if applicable
3. [Sworn Declaration](https://help.gcash.com/hc/article_attachments/31653530349465) stamped received by the BIR

The Sworn Declaration will be used to properly determine if the merchant will be subject to the RR No. 16-2023.

Partner Merchants may submit their requirements to GCash via this [link](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfYLPo2E4nvnnDZ0d1rvXSR7dkoabG03uGO9_20WDeS1N_Kew/viewform).

For more information, please refer to the [full text of RR No. 16-2023](https://bir-cdn.bir.gov.ph/BIR/pdf/RR%20No.%2016-2023%203.pdf) from the BIR’s website.

### Refund Information

According to [RMC No. 79-2024](https://help.gcash.com/hc/article_attachments/35191547222809), which extends the transition period of Revenue Regulation 16-2023, any withheld amounts due to the delay in notification will be promptly refunded to the merchant's settlement bank account. We ask for the merchants' patience as GCash processes the refunds.
